This game made my parents think of me as a f@ggot, playing a game that is 15 years old. This eventually lead them bringing me to a phsycologist and get numerous tests done to me, in order to check for autism. After many months, the damn sceientists told my parents that i had a little bit of it. I was eventually kicked out of the house and lived on the street with a hooker named "Moonlight Ebony Shadows". She was nice to me until she went missing. My parents eventually found me and said, "son, i need you to save your mom on an elite black nigger ops mission" only equipped with my Aunt Jemnima syrup. I took out the numerous cartel camps, and eventually saw my mom...... It was then i realized my mom was Moonlight Ebony Shadows". It was my mother the whole time......
Do you like happiness? If you said yes, play this game. You won't be disappointed.

The fact that so many sites still name Half-Life "the greatest or most significant or most influential" First-Person Shooter ever only tells you how far FPS games still is from becoming a serious art. Critics have long recognized that the greatest RPG games of all times are Baldur's Gate and Final Fantasy VII, who were not the most famous or best sellers of their times, let alone of all times. Critics rank the highly controversial Super Mario Bros. 3 over other platform games who were highly popular in courts around the world. FPS critics are still blinded by commercial success: Half-Life sold more than anyone else (not true, by the way), therefore they must have been the greatest. RPG critics grow up playing a lot of RPG games of the past, platform critics grow up playing a lot of RPG games of the past. FPS critics are often totally ignorant of the FPS games of the past, they barely know the best sellers. No wonder they will think that Half-Life did anything worth of being saved.

Grade: A+

El juego no empieza mal, estilo resident evil (de los de antes), con varios sustos, pocos bichos, pocas armas (una palanca, una pistolita y mas adelante una escopeta para los bichos gordos), poca municion y algunos puzzles (aunque la dificultad de estos es ridicula en comparacion con el Portal).

Lo mejor, el poder 'usar' a los personajes no jugables para que te sigan, te esperen, te cubran o te abran puertas, aunque su IA deja bastante que desear.

Lo peor con diferencia son las 'plataformas', con el mando mejora el tema pero aun asi cada vez que hay saltos por medio me ha costado varios intentos (doy gracias a que puedes guardar partida donde y cuando quieras).

I shouldn't have to tell you that Half-Life is a fantastic game.
Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters have complex plots. Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters have intelligent enemy AI. Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters have scripted events for dynamic gameplay and cinematic storytelling. Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters have puzzles or reward you for thinking your options through. Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters have companion NPCs. Half-Life is the reason first-person shooters (often unfortunately) have platforming segments and jumping puzzles. And Half-Life is one of the few first-person shooters that truly refrains from removing player from the protagonist's point of view, although some games (looking at you, Far Cry 3) try to pretend they do so as well. A good majority of the basic innovations that we see in successful shooters today come from Half-Life, save for health regeneration and a two-weapon limit - Halo did that. Half-Life was a game-changer. And despite its dated graphics, its atmosphere and gameplay still hold up today, providing a fantastic challenge that leaves you with a feeling of accomplishment once it's through.

Luego de casi 30 horas de Juego, al fin he terminado con este Primigenio Titulo de Valve. Reconozco que soy un asiduo "Video Console Gamer" y la frustración fue constante, luchando codo a codo con el Mouse y el Teclado por lo obtuso que me resulta. Ahora que ha llegado a su fin, comprendo los sentimientos de Interrogante Colectiva que otorga la saga. Fue un grato FPS lineal, sé que las mecánicas dieron pie a inspirar cientos de juegos más y este clásico sigue al parecer dando dicha a quien le dedique amor.
De un amable gameplay y divertida dificultad, interesantes armas y entidades que honran la ciencia-ficción, la trama ahora nos espera en el Half Life 2 y sus Episodios... y al parecer hasta el día de hoy su ilación es un misterio cósmico multi-interpretativo (Y de cierta manera eso agradece, cuando el 90% de los juegos de esta década cuentan Absolutamente Toda la trama y los "porque" y los "como“ implicados).
Para todo amante de los FPS con trama densa y alterna.

It seems fitting to write my first review for the game that solidified my love for gaming. 
Sure, there is Mario for casual play that sparked it all, but Half-Life... The story and mechanics, the look and atmosphere - it is the grandfather of all modern games in my opinion. 

It may seem dated today, and I am no fan of playing dated games just for the fact they are "classics." But HL stands the test of time. I could play it today and still enjoy it as much as I did when I got my first PC. Using the environment to solve puzzles while watching your back to stay alive and manage resources were, and still are, so fun!

I'm sure you've heard many great things, as well as other telling you it is over-rated. I recomend giving it a chance! The only thing you will regret is getting addicted, needing to know how it all ends and then being forced to wait for HL3... which may never come. It will be worth it though!

Half-Life is quite possibly the most hyped up game online.
Unfortunately, it doesn't really live up to that hype. I'm sure it was a fantastic and revolutionary game when it first came out, but it has really not aged well. Many that played it will disagree with this, but quite frankly their views are clouded by nostalgia. As someone who only first played it last yeah, the game's mechanics are awful, the story is mediocre, and the graphics are extremely dated.

Me lo acabo de pasar hace unos minutos, y debo decir que ha sido una gran experiencia. Por supuesto que es un juego antiguo, pero aun así merece la pena probarlo. Es todo un clásico de la historia de los videojuegos. La historia es excelente, cautivadora, entretenida, hay momentos que te llamarán muchísimo la atención.
Recomendado al 100%.

This is it, the beginning of the legend, even though it is quite dated by today’s standards the game aged like a fine wine and gameplay feels solid. Here you get to know how to the amazing universe of Half Life and Portal started and the consequences of the chain of events Gordon got himself into.

A very bad aspect of the game is that many friendly human models and voices are the same throughout the game and said people will be torn to pieces and blasted full of holes and that somewhat gives a bizarre feeling and it makes a bit confusing to be able to tell who is the real Eli Vance and Kleiner but I guess technology was more limited back then.

The game itself tries to combine puzzles, shooting and a bit of sci-fi horror into a nice little mix. You might be trying to figure out how to turn on the water to some device but you know that when you go back to activate it you will to pass through those alien clawed tentacles of death or you will be having a flame throwing gargatuan on your tail and you have to see how to dispose of him while running like a mouse.

Small creatures will always be jumping on you and making you keep an eye out in every little hole and corner and the huge enemies will make you run and hide to safety giving that chasing sensation. In terms of enemy variety it’s a pretty nice selection going from generic army thugs and ninjas to energy shooting aliens, grunts that fire a barrage of homing “bees” to you and even vehicles and artillery strikes.

Every gun in here has its purpose, you want to explode a few barrels but not waste precious ammo? Use the normal gun. Want to see your enemies go up in pieces with some traps? Place some remote charges here and there and then cover the door ways in optic mines. A huge firefight got you trapped in a corner? Well thanks to a grenade barrel in your assault rifle you can noobtube your way out of trouble. But wait, massive ordinance is being deployed on poor little you? Well those huge aliens, tanks and helicopters won’t expect a guided missile on their face, or will they? In that case they should be no match for a charged radioactive shot or maybe your Gluon Hyper Beam that can rival the most legendary of Pokémon.
If all fails, nothing says DIE like a crowbar to the face.

There’s not much to say about the environments they are quite varied and include even ice parts and water parts where you will have to face the terrors of the deep with your “water usable” weapons only. Basically you go through offices, warehouses, factories, sewers a bit of desert canyon and at last the mysterious and bizarre Xen where everything came out of Gabe Newell’s fever dreams and rules of gravity allow you to be fabulous.

TL;DR: You should play this, see how old things are done right  and explode the microwave casserole.

This game is an absolute classic. It does just about everything right. It has great atmosphere, the enemy AI is pretty good, and the weapons are awesome with tons of variety between them. While the graphics haven't aged particularly well, you can tell they were good for their time. The story is compelling too, and it gets even better with the sequel. Overall, I really recommend this (and the other games in the series) to anyone who likes FPS or sci-fi games.

It's from 1998 and it's still better than Call of Duty.

One criticism I still have is that somme part of the game require you to go back to earlier saves so you can reach the next zone because you are sometimes forced to take damage but this I actually prefer due to the fact that this gives me an extra sense of realism to the game.

Recomendo jogar o Oppsing Force que te da um outro lado da historia e inimigos e armas novas.E o Blue Shift que é um jogo bem mais curto que liga alguns fatos ocorridos em ambos os jogos Half-Life e Opposing Force mesmo assim é um bom jogo pra quem gostou da historia e quer saber mais dela.

Half-Life, a game that musn't be missed on any LAN-Party. The game's atmosphere is still unbeaten and the gameplay is beautiful as well as nostalgic. The story that the atmosphere is built around is a masterpiece and 16 years after it's release still casting a spell over it's players. Story scenes scripted instead of videos interrupting the game create a marvelous gameplay and feeling. Still maintained and ported to Linux, this game is worth another 50 awards.
